result.execSummary:
The defendant JOSE M FERNANDEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)4.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:18 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Steven Richards.  Kyle Sargent as special prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter sworn.  Atty Richards has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, and states the corrections, no additions or deletions.  Special Prosecutor has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Sentencing argument by Atty Sargent.  Sentencing argument by Atty Richards.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Ct 1 - 6 years of Initial Confinement and 6 years of Extended Supervision

Ct 2 - 2 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to count 1.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Court costs
AODA and any follow-up
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with any known drug users or drug dealers
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the SAP program but not the CIP program

Court grants the defedant 403 days of sentence credit.

Sentence is to commence immediately.

Court adjourned at 10:53 a.m.
Court Record Text sealed by Judge Slate on "Other papers" event, dated 3-30-2015
records.descr: Order to seal court record text

records.addlTxt: Court record text sealed by Judge Slate
from Atty Steven Richards dated March 24, 2015 with (8) letters from family members for consideration at sentencing
to counsel with copy of the presentence investigation report
Sentencing hearing on March 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
for Consolidation and Waiver of Jurisdictional Rights
Consent to Enter pleas in the County of Custody
same as amended information filed on 12/04/2014
Sentencing hearing on March 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.

10:47 a.m.  State by Special Prosecutor Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Steven Richards.  Enrique Soria, interpreter, present.

Interpreter sworn.

Attorney Sargent recites agreement - defendant plea to counts 1 and 2 of the Information - there will be 2 uncharged readins from Waupaca County - one count of delivery of THC and a count of delivery of cocaine.  Attorney Richards concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court has received a request for consolidation - DA requests for the consolidation - Attorney Richard concurs - defendant concurs.  

Court has received an Amended Information.  Attorney Richards enters a plea of NO CONTEST on behalf of the defendant.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offenses.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties on each count.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to both counts.  Court finds each plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support each plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on both counts and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report and to be completed within sixty days.  Both counsel to contact the JA for a sentencing date.

Court adjourned at 10:58 a.m.
Plea hearing on December 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.

10:39 a.m.  State by Special Prosecutor Kyle Sargent, via telephone.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Steven Richards.  Enrique Soria, interpreter, present.  

Statement by Attorney Richards - considering a consolidation of charges to Green Lake County.  

Court directs case be set for Plea Hearing for December 23, 2014.

Court adjourned at 10:42 a.m.
Status hearing on November 25, 2014 at 10:30 am.

9:10 a.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present in person.  Attorney Steven Richards present via telephone.  Interpreter, Enrique Soria, present.

Interpreter sworn.

Court makes statement regarding the special prosecutor appointment.  Statement by Attorney Richards - believes Outagamie County prosecutor will be prosecuting on this case.  Requests this case be adjourned for 30 to 45 days for a potential consolidation.  

Court directs Attorney Richards to contact JA for scheduling (Status Hearing) - may be on a non-interpreter date.

Court adjourned at 9:15 a.m.
Status hearing on August 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

1:59 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Steven Richards.  Enqrique Soria, interpreter, present.

Interpreter sworn.

Court makes statement regarding the appointed Special Prosecutor.

Statement by Attorney Richards - potential consolidation of charges to Green Lake County.  

Court directs further Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days - Attorney Richards requests defendant to be brought up for said hearing.

Court adjourned at 2:03 p.m.
under Chapter 978 - Carrie Schneider
Status hearing on July 22, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

2:08 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Steven Richards present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Richards - requests a sixty day adjournment.  DA concurs.  Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately sixty days.

Court adjourned at 2:10 p.m.
State's
Status hearing on May 27, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

2:06  p.m.   State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Steven Richards.  Interpreter, Amar Miller, present.

Interpreter sworn.

Statement by Attorney Richards - has not yet received discovery - requests a status hearing be held in approximately thirty days.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 2:08 p.m.
By Atty Steven G. Richards
Status hearing on April 22, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

1:34 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present in person, in custody, with Attorney Steven Richard.  Amar Miller, interpreter, present.

Interpreter sworn.  

- Rafael D. sworn, direct by DA.  Employed by the Wisconsin Department of Justice.  So employed on February 21, 2014.  Goes over the date in question.  Identified the defendant present in court.  Venue established.  Cross examination by Attorney Richards.  

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony has been committed and finds probable cause to believe the felony was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the Court and provides a copy to Attorney Richards.  Attorney Richards confirms receipt of the Information -  waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Attorney Richards enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs Status Hearing be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 1:53 p.m.
Bail/Bond - Defendant refused to sign
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to leave the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is to have NO contact with anyone involved in the trafficking of narcotics.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or any prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

2:27 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Interpreter, Amar Miller, present.  Defendant present in person.  Attorney Steve Richards present via telephone and on behalf of the defendant.

Interpreter sworn.   Attorney Richards indicates the defendant has received a copy of the complaint and requests a preliminary hearing.  Court reads the complaint and instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  

Bond recommendation made by the State.  Attorney Richards will defer any bond argument at this time.  Court orders bond set at $250,000.00 cash with the conditions of:  Not to leave the State of Wisconsin .  No contact with anyone involved in the trafficking of narcotics.  Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or any prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Attorney Richards does not waive the time limits as to the preliminary hearing if his schedule would allow.  If not, would be prepared to waive the time limits.  Court will schedule to be held within the next ten days.  Attorney Richards to contact the JA for scheduling.

Court adjourned at 2:38 p.m.

2:47 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present, in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail, without an attorney.

Defendant requests an interpreter.  Court adjourns to February 25, 2014 at 2:15 p.m. for an interpreter to be present.  Statement by DA.  Court makes statement regarding probable cause and making a finding of probable cause.

Court adjourned at 2:49 p.m.
